sentence.Network_en: Images which glorify violence and cruelty, serve to legitimise such behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些美化暴力和暴行的图片，就是要使此等行为合理化。

sentence.Network_en: I'm not trying to glorify or idealise women.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不是要美化女人或把她们理想化。

sentence.Network_en: You would glorify with the most fervent gratitude the God.
sentence.Network_cn: 你会用最热忱的感激崇拜上帝.

list.abs: as a practical matter , then , Huntsman still will be a glorified messenger , serving at the will of the president .当然，遇到实际问题时，亨茨曼仍将是一个光荣的使者，服务于总统的意志。
Of course we cannot sanctify and glorify God without obeying him ., 当然 , 没有顺服我们不能尊崇和荣耀神.

this seems harsh , but it serves as a warning to spiritual leaders of the seriousness of their calling and the great responsibilities they to glorify God in all things and at all times .这个惩罚似乎太严厉，但却是用来警告属灵领袖他们的使命有何等重要，他们必须在每一时、每一事上荣耀上帝。
i glorify myself for who i am ., 美化自己的我是谁.
He just knows how to glorify himself , don ' t overestimate him ., 他这人只会自我吹捧 , 你可别高看了他.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French glorifier, from ecclesiastical Latin glorificare, from late Latin glorificus, from Latin gloria 'glory'

entry.def: To glorify something means to praise it or make it seem good or special, usually when it is not.

example.ex: This magazine in no way glorifies gangs.
example.tran: 这本杂志绝对没有美化混混们。

example.ex: ...the banning of songs glorifying war and racism.
example.tran: 对吹捧战争和种族歧视的歌曲的禁播令

entry.def: If you glorify God, you praise Him.

example.ex: We are all committed to serving the Lord and glorifying His name in the best way we know.
example.tran: 我们全心全意敬奉上帝，竭尽所能颂扬他的美名。

sentences.sentence: "The victory over the enemy glorified the Republic"

means.word_mean: 3. elevate or idealize, in allusion to Christ's transfiguration

sentences.sentence: "You are glorifying a rather mediocre building"

sentences.en: The author glorified the life of the peasants.
sentences.cn: 那个作者赞美了农民的生活。
